title: Aarhus
summary: Aarhus (/ˈɔːrhuːs/, US also /ˈɑːr-/,[3][4][5][6] Danish: [ˈɒːˌhuˀs] (listen); officially spelled Århus from 1948 until 1 January 2011[7][note 1]) is the second-largest city in Denmark and the seat of Aarhus municipality. It is located on the eastern shore of Jutland in the Kattegat sea and approximately 187 kilometres (116 mi) northwest of Copenhagen.
